meanings.def: the appearance that things have that results from the way in which they reflect light. Red, orange and green are colors.
examples: What's your favorite color?
bright/vibrant colors
dark/light colors
She always wears dark colors.
vivid/rich/bold colors
a warm color palette (= the range of colors used for something)
available in 12 different colors
the color of the sky
skin/hair/eye color
in color red/green/blue in color
Her hair is a reddish-brown color.
The stage lights changed color from red to blue.
Foods that go through a factory process lose much of their color, flavor and texture.

meanings.def: the use of all the colors, not only black and white
examples: the introduction of color television in the 1960s
color photographs
a color printer
a full-color brochure
in color Do you dream in color?

meanings.def: the color of a person’s skin, when it shows the race they belong to
examples: Discrimination on the grounds of race, religion or color was outlawed.
people of all ages, genders, creeds and colors
Can we seriously believe people who claim not to see color?

meanings.def: a red or pink color in somebody’s face, especially when it shows that they look healthy or that they are embarrassed
examples: The fresh air brought color to their cheeks.
Color flooded her face when she thought of what had happened.
His face was drained of color (= he looked pale and ill).

meanings.def: a substance that is used to give color to something
examples: a semi-permanent hair color that lasts six to eight washes
This color runs, so wash the shirt separately.

meanings.def: interesting and exciting details or qualities
examples: The old town is full of color and attractions.
to give/lend color to something (= make it brighter, more interesting, etc.)
Her acting added warmth and color to the production.

meanings.def: the particular colors that are used on clothes, flags, etc. to represent a team, school, political party or country
examples: Red and white are the team colors.
Spain’s national colors
(figurative) There are people of different political colors on the committee.

meanings.def: a flag, badge, etc. that represents a team, country, ship, etc.
examples: sailing under the French colors

meanings.def: to say publicly and clearly what you believe or who you support

examples: people of color
As a woman of color, this concerns me.
a literary prize for writers of color
students of color

meanings.def: to make sure that somebody has enough money to pay for something
examples: You need to see the color of his money before you sell him the car.

meanings.def: your real character, rather than the one that you usually allow other people to see
examples: It was only after they got married that he showed himself in his true colors.

meanings.def: very well; with a very high mark
examples: She passed the exam with flying colors.

idioms.idiom: nail your colors to the mast
idioms.def: to say publicly and clearly what you believe or who you support

examples: people of color
As a woman of color, this concerns me.
a literary prize for writers of color
students of color

idioms.idiom: see the color of somebody’s money
idioms.def: to make sure that somebody has enough money to pay for something
examples: You need to see the color of his money before you sell him the car.

idioms.def: your real character, rather than the one that you usually allow other people to see
examples: It was only after they got married that he showed himself in his true colors.

idioms.def: very well; with a very high mark
examples: She passed the exam with flying colors.

meanings.def: to put color on something using paint, colored pencils, etc.
examples: The children love to draw and color.
color something How long have you been coloring (= dyeing) your hair?
color something + adj. He drew a monster and colored it green.

meanings.def: to become red because the person is embarrassed
examples: She colored at his remarks.

meanings.def: to affect something, especially in a negative way
examples: This incident colored her whole life.
Don't let your judgment be colored by personal feelings.
